publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5536 Bruce Crawford: Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies—That the Parliament expresses concern at Pfizer Global Pharmaceuticals’ (PGP) proposal to distribute its medicines through a single distribution channel in the United Kingdom; believes that this will damage the pharmaceutical wholesale network in Scotland and will have cost implications for the NHS in Scotland; further believes that this will reduce service levels and be detrimental to patient care in Scotland; is concerned that, if other pharmaceutical manufacturers follow suit, this will further compound the problem by reducing service levels and increasing administrative burdens which will adversely affect the ability of community pharmacists to deliver pharmaceutical care to the people of Scotland, and therefore considers that the Scottish Executive should seek to persuade PGP to review its decision.
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Mr Adam Ingram*

S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Tricia Marwick*, Jim Mather*, Alex Neil*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, John Swinburne*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Ms Sandra White*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Phil Gallie*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Richard Lochhead*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Roseanna Cunningham*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Mr Andrew Welsh*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Linda Fabiani*, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Ms Maureen Watt*, Frances Curran*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Mr Bruce McFee* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Colin Fox*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Rosie Kane*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Patrick Harvie*
S2M-5536 Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies (lodged on 2 February 2007) Chris Ballance*

S2M-5536 Bruce Crawford: Impact of Pfizer’s Change of Wholesale Practice on Scottish Pharmacies—That the Parliament expresses concern at Pfizer Global Pharmaceuticals’ (PGP) proposal to distribute its medicines through a single distribution channel in the United Kingdom; believes that this will damage the pharmaceutical wholesale network in Scotland and will have cost implications for the NHS in Scotland; further believes that this will reduce service levels and be detrimental to patient care in Scotland; is concerned that, if other pharmaceutical manufacturers follow suit, this will further compound the problem by reducing service levels and increasing administrative burdens which will adversely affect the ability of community pharmacists to deliver pharmaceutical care to the people of Scotland, and therefore considers that the Scottish Executive should seek to persuade PGP to review its decision. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick, Jim Mather, Alex Neil, Mr Kenny MacAskill, John Swinburne, Rob Gibson, Christine Grahame, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Ms Sandra White, Fiona Hyslop, Phil Gallie, Richard Lochhead, Dr Jean Turner, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Andrew Welsh, Linda Fabiani, Dennis Canavan, Eleanor Scott, Ms Maureen Watt, Frances Curran, Mr Bruce McFee, Colin Fox, Rosie Kane, Patrick Harvie, Chris Ballance
